title: Supermodel Fabio Mancini talks about his friendship with Ian Thorpe
text:
He's modeled for the likes of Armani, Dior and Dolce & Gabbana.

And Italian supermodel Fabio Mancini also calls Aussie swimming legend Ian Thorpe a mate.

On Saturday, the 31-year-old told The Daily Telegraph that the five-time Olympic Gold Medalist has been acting as his tour guide on his visit Down Under.

'I look up to him': Italian supermodel Fabio Mancini (pictured) has opened up about his friendship with Ian Thorpe who he calls an 'icon'

'I met Ian a while ago and he has been showing me around Sydney', he told the publication.

Before the chiselled hunk added: 'I used to want to be a swimmer so I look up to him, he is an icon.'

On Tuesday, Fabio attended the Bulgari Art Award cocktail gala at the Art Gallery of NSW alongside a glittering array of guests, including bikini blogger Natasha Oakley, actress Isabel Lucas and models Alexandra Agoston and Amy Pejkovic.

Fancy a dip? Fabio is based in Milan, Italy and is one of the the world's most in demand male models

Sharing is caring: 'I used to want to be a swimmer so I look up to him, he is an icon,' said Fabio of his friendship with Ian (pictured)

Fabio is based in Milan, Italy and is one of the the world's most in-demand male models.

But despite being consistently ranked within the Top 50 sexiest models in the world by models.com, the bronzed God is the first to admit it's what's on the inside that counts.

'For me the most sexy thing in the world is the way you are, it is not only your body, it is more about what is inside', confessed Fabio.

So smart: Despite being consistently ranked within the Top 50 sexiest male models in the world, the bronzed God believes beauty is often skin deep

He then went on to reveal one of the many pitfalls of being genetically blessed.

'It can be difficult because people are usually interested in who you are outside, not inside,' he said.

The professional poser will be in Australia working for the next two months.
description: He's modeled for the likes of Armani, Dior and Dolce & Gabbana.
authors: Joe Scek For Daily Mail Australia
